partintro.para: FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol.

The following constants are defined when using the FTP module:
FTP_ASCII, and FTP_BINARY.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens up an FTP connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a FTP stream on success, false on error.
ftp_connect opens up a FTP connection to the specified host. The port parameter specifies an alternate port to connect to. If it is omitted or zero, then the default FTP port, 21, will be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Logs in an FTP connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
Logs in the given FTP stream.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the current directory name

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the current directory, or false on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Changes to the parent directory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
Changes to the parent directory.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Changes directories on a FTP server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
Changes to the specified directory.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates a directory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the newly created directory name on success, false on error.
Creates the specified directory.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Removes a directory

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
Removes the specified directory.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a list of files in the given directory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an array of filenames on success, false on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns a detailed list of files in the given directory.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_rawlist executes the FTP LIST command, and returns the result as an array. Each array element corresponds to one line of text. The output is not parsed in any way. The system type identifier returned by ftp_systype can be used to determine how the results should be interpreted.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the system type identifier of the remote FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the remote system type, or false on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Turns passive mode on or off.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_pasv turns on passive mode if the pasv parameter is true (it turns off passive mode if pasv is false.) In passive mode, data connections are initiated by the client, rather than by the server.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Downloads a file from the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_get retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and saves it to local_file locally. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Downloads a file from the FTP server and saves to an open file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_fget retrieves remote_file from the FTP server, and writes it to the given file pointer, fp. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Uploads a file to the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_put stores local_file on the FTP server, as remote_file. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Uploads from an open file to the FTP server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_fput uploads the data from the file pointer fp until end of file. The results are stored in remote_file on the FTP server. The transfer mode specified must be either FTP_ASCII or FTP_BINARY.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the size of the given file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the file size on success, or -1 on error.
ftp_size returns the size of a file. If an error occurs, of if the file does not exist, -1 is returned. Not all servers support this feature.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the last modified time of the given file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns a UNIX timestamp on success, or -1 on error.
ftp_mdtm checks the last-modified time for a file, and returns it as a UNIX timestamp. If an error occurs, or the file does not exist, -1 is returned. Note that not all servers support this feature.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Renames a file on the ftp server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_rename renames the file specified by from to the new name to

refnamediv.refpurpose: Deletes a file on the ftp server.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns true on success, false on error.
ftp_delete deletes the file specified by path from the FTP server.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes an FTP connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ftp_connect closes ftp_stream.
